title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
text: SeuratVisPro adds innovative visualization analysis helpers top Seurat v5.

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 300, n_genes = 800, n_clusters = 3, spatial = TRUE) #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 12023 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8321 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds DimPlot(obj)

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: VisQCPanel(obj, genes_ribo = "^RPL|^RPS")

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: ma <- VisMarkerAtlas(obj, top_n = 5) #> Calculating cluster 0 #> For a (much!) faster implementation of the Wilcoxon Rank Sum Test, #> (default method for FindMarkers) please install the presto package #> -------------------------------------------- #> install.packages('devtools') #> devtools::install_github('immunogenomics/presto') #> -------------------------------------------- #> After installation of presto, Seurat will automatically use the more  #> efficient implementation (no further action necessary). #> This message will be shown once per session #> Calculating cluster 1 #> Calculating cluster 2 #> As of Seurat v5, we recommend using AggregateExpression to perform pseudo-bulk analysis. #> First group.by variable `ident` starts with a number, appending `g` to ensure valid variable names #> This message is displayed once per session. ma$plot

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: obj$batch <- sample(c('A','B'), ncol(obj), replace = TRUE) bm <- VisBatchAlign(obj, batch = 'batch') bm$plot

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: VisGeneTrend(obj, features = c('G10','G20'), by = 'pseudotime') #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: lr <- data.frame(ligand = paste0('G', 1:5), receptor = paste0('G', 6:10)) lrp <- VisLigRec(obj, lr_table = lr, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') lrp$plot

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: VisClusterTree(obj, dist.metric = 'correlation', linkage = 'average', show_heatmap = TRUE)

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: sets <- list(SetA = paste0('G', 1:10), SetB = paste0('G', 11:20)) VisMetaFeature(obj, feature_sets = sets, group.by = 'seurat_clusters')$plot #> Warning: The `slot` argument of `GetAssayData()` is deprecated as of SeuratObject 5.0.0. #> ℹ Please use the `layer` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the SeuratVisPro package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://example.com/SeuratVisPro/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: s.genes <- paste0('G', 1:10); g2m.genes <- paste0('G', 11:20) VisCellCycle(obj, s.genes, g2m.genes)$plot

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: launchSeuratVisPro()

title: SeuratVisPro Tutorial
code: VisEmbeddingContour(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') #> Warning: The dot-dot notation (`..level..`) was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `after_stat(level)` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the SeuratVisPro package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://example.com/SeuratVisPro/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. VisRankedDotmap(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters', top_n = 6) #> Calculating cluster 0 #> Calculating cluster 1 #> Calculating cluster 2 VisGeneCoexpHive(obj, genes = paste0('G', 1:12), threshold = 0.2) #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the SeuratVisPro package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://example.com/SeuratVisPro/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: Authors and Citation
text: SeuratVisPro Team. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Team S (2025). SeuratVisPro: Innovative Visualization Analysis Toolkit Seurat v5. R package version 0.1.0, https://example.com/SeuratVisPro.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SeuratVisPro: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5},   author = {SeuratVisPro Team},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://example.com/SeuratVisPro}, }

what: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
text: 面向Seurat v5的创新型单细胞可视化与分析工具包。聚焦真实项目痛点，提供聚类稳健性诊断、批次混合评估、群体标志物图谱、配体-受体方向评分、趋势曲线、群体树与相似性热图、空间叠色回退、发表级点图以及基因协同结构径向网络等功能，并集成Shiny（支持bs4Dash可选）便于交互探索。

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
text: 聚类稳健性：分辨率×重采样一致性曲线定量选择超参，补足官方工作流的“稳健性度量”。 批次混合诊断：嵌入空间邻域批次差异比例快速定位整合问题群体。 标志物与相似性：Marker atlas与群体树+热图组合，多视角呈现群体差异与近似程度。 通信与趋势：群体×群体LR共表达热图与伪时间/分组平滑曲线，便于机制与时序分析。 空间回退：无真实图像也可依赖坐标/嵌入进行“空间式”叠色，保障工作流不中断。 发表级美化：统一svpp_theme()与viridis色系参数化，图形风格一致可控。

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
text: 稳健性：VisClusterStability 对每个分辨率进行重复抽样，按细胞名对齐完整与子样本的簇分配，计算一致性均值并绘制曲线。 批次：VisBatchAlign 在嵌入上构建k近邻（基于距离排序），统计邻居批次与自身差异比例，分组比较混合程度。 树与热图：VisClusterTree 基于群体平均表达，支持欧氏或相关性度量与多种联接法，树下叠加相似性热图。 通信：VisLigRec 基于平均表达计算LR对在源/靶群体的乘积均值，形成方向性评分矩阵。 趋势：VisGeneTrend 从UMAP/PCA近似伪时间或任意元数据分组，绘制loess/gam平滑曲线。 空间：VisSpatialOverlay 优先使用SpatialFeaturePlot，无图像时回退至x,y或嵌入坐标点染色。 点图与网络：VisRankedDotmap 合并平均表达与表达比例，VisGeneCoexpHive 使用相关性构建径向网络。

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
code: library(SeuratVisPro) obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 300, n_genes = 800, n_clusters = 3, spatial = TRUE) VisClusterStability(obj)$plot VisClusterTree(obj, dist.metric = 'correlation', show_heatmap = TRUE) VisSpatialOverlay(obj, features = c('G1','G2')) VisRankedDotmap(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters', top_n = 6) VisGeneCoexpHive(obj, genes = paste0('G',1:12), threshold = 0.2)

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
code: library(SeuratVisPro) obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells=400, n_genes=800, n_clusters=4, spatial=TRUE) obj$batch <- sample(c('A','B'), ncol(obj), replace=TRUE)  # 1) 质控面板（静态） VisQCPanel(obj, genes_mt='^MT-', genes_ribo='^RPL|^RPS', group.by='seurat_clusters')  # 2) 聚类稳健性 stab <- VisClusterStability(obj, resolution_range=seq(0.2,1.2,0.2), reps=3) stab$plot; head(stab$summary)  # 3) 标志物图谱 ma <- VisMarkerAtlas(obj, top_n=5) ma$plot; head(ma$markers)  # 4) 批次混合诊断 ba <- VisBatchAlign(obj, batch='batch', reduction='pca') ba$plot; head(ba$summary)  # 5) 基因趋势（伪时间或分组） VisGeneTrend(obj, features=c('G10','G20','G30'), by='pseudotime')  # 6) 配体-受体方向评分 lr <- data.frame(ligand=paste0('G',1:5), receptor=paste0('G',6:10)) lrres <- VisLigRec(obj, lr_table=lr, group.by='seurat_clusters') lrres$plot; head(lrres$scores)  # 7) 模块分数（元特征） ms <- VisMetaFeature(obj, feature_sets=list(SetA=paste0('G',1:10), SetB=paste0('G',11:20)), group.by='seurat_clusters') ms$plot  # 8) 细胞周期视图 cc <- VisCellCycle(obj, s.genes=paste0('G',1:10), g2m.genes=paste0('G',11:20)) cc$plot  # 9) 嵌入等高线（原创） VisEmbeddingContour(obj, group.by='seurat_clusters', levels=5)  # 10) 排序点图（原创） VisRankedDotmap(obj, group.by='seurat_clusters', top_n=6)  # 11) 协同网络径向图（原创） VisGeneCoexpHive(obj, genes=paste0('G',1:12), threshold=0.2)  # 12) 空间叠色（含非空间回退） VisSpatialOverlay(obj, features=c('G1','G2','G3'))  # 13) Hex-binned 熵热图（原创，群体混合度） VisHexEntropy(obj, group.by='seurat_clusters', bins=30)  # 14) 局部Moran's I热点（原创，空间自相关） VisLocalMoran(obj, gene='G10', k=15)  # 15) 群体质心流图（原创，MST指示潜在转移） VisClusterFlowGraph(obj, group.by='seurat_clusters')  # 13) 启动Shiny（bs4Dash仪表盘） launchSeuratVisPro()  # 需已安装 bs4Dash

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
code: # 需要安装 bs4Dash install.packages('bs4Dash') launchSeuratVisPro() # 使用bs4Dash仪表盘布局

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
text: 在具备Pandoc的环境中： 新函数的帮助文档由roxygen注释自动生成，构建站点后将出现在docs/reference。
code: pkgdown::build_site() # 生成docs目录用于GitHub Pages

title: Innovative Visualization and Analysis Toolkit for Seurat v5
text: Imports: ggplot2, dplyr, tidyr, patchwork, shiny, DT, stats, methods, tibble, ggdendro, plotly, rlang, Seurat, scales, Matrix 可选：bs4Dash（Shiny界面增强，未安装则自动回退）。

title: Launch SeuratVisPro Shiny app — launchSeuratVisPro
text: Launch bundled Shiny application showcasing key functions examples.

title: Launch SeuratVisPro Shiny app — launchSeuratVisPro
code: launchSeuratVisPro(port = 8888, host = "127.0.0.1")

title: Launch SeuratVisPro Shiny app — launchSeuratVisPro
text: port Port run app . host Host interface.

title: Launch SeuratVisPro Shiny app — launchSeuratVisPro
text: return value; launches local Shiny app.

title: Launch SeuratVisPro Shiny app — launchSeuratVisPro
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ launchSeuratVisPro() } # }

what: Example Seurat object for demonstrations — SeuratVisProExample
title: Example Seurat object for demonstrations — SeuratVisProExample
text: Generate small synthetic Seurat object suitable examples testing.

title: Example Seurat object for demonstrations — SeuratVisProExample
code: SeuratVisProExample(   n_cells = 300,   n_genes = 1000,   n_clusters = 3,   seed = 123,   spatial = FALSE )

title: Example Seurat object for demonstrations — SeuratVisProExample
text: n_cells Number cells. n_genes Number genes. n_clusters Number simulated clusters. seed Random seed reproducibility. spatial TRUE, adds synthetic spatial coordinates 'x','y' meta.data.

title: Example Seurat object for demonstrations — SeuratVisProExample
text: Seurat object basic preprocessing (normalization, variable features, PCA, UMAP).

title: Example Seurat object for demonstrations — SeuratVisProExample
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 400, n_genes = 1000, n_clusters = 4) #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 400 #> Number of edges: 15293 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8748 #> Number of communities: 4 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds Seurat::DimPlot(obj, group.by = "cluster")

title: Batch mixing diagnostics — VisBatchAlign
text: Quantify visualize batch mixing kNN graph /integration.

title: Batch mixing diagnostics — VisBatchAlign
code: VisBatchAlign(   object,   batch,   reduction = "pca",   dims = 1:10,   k = 20,   palette = "C" )

title: Batch mixing diagnostics — VisBatchAlign
text: object Seurat object. batch Column name meta.data indicating batch. reduction Dimensional reduction use kNN (e.g., 'pca' 'umap'). dims Dimensions use. k Number neighbors. palette Viridis palette option.

title: Batch mixing diagnostics — VisBatchAlign
text: list summary data plot comparing neighbor batch composition.

title: Batch mixing diagnostics — VisBatchAlign
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds obj$batch <- sample(c('A','B'), ncol(obj), replace = TRUE) res <- VisBatchAlign(obj, batch = 'batch', reduction = 'pca') res$plot

title: Cell cycle visualization — VisCellCycle
text: Score cell cycle visualize embedding distribution.

title: Cell cycle visualization — VisCellCycle
code: VisCellCycle(object, s.genes, g2m.genes, reduction = "umap", dims = 1:10)

title: Cell cycle visualization — VisCellCycle
text: object Seurat object. s.genes Character vector S phase genes. g2m.genes Character vector G2/M phase genes. reduction Reduction name overlay. dims Dimensions neighbor graph.

title: Cell cycle visualization — VisCellCycle
text: list updated object patchwork plot.

title: Cell cycle visualization — VisCellCycle
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds s.genes <- paste0('G', 1:10); g2m.genes <- paste0('G', 11:20) res <- VisCellCycle(obj, s.genes, g2m.genes) res$plot

what: Cluster centroid flow graph on embeddings — VisClusterFlowGraph

title: Cluster centroid flow graph on embeddings — VisClusterFlowGraph
code: VisClusterFlowGraph(object, group.by = "seurat_clusters", reduction = "umap")

title: Cluster centroid flow graph on embeddings — VisClusterFlowGraph
text: object Seurat object. group.Metadata column cluster identity. reduction Reduction name, default 'umap'.

title: Cluster centroid flow graph on embeddings — VisClusterFlowGraph
text: ggplot centroid nodes MST edges.

title: Cluster centroid flow graph on embeddings — VisClusterFlowGraph
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 300, n_genes = 800, n_clusters = 3) #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 12023 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8321 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds p <- VisClusterFlowGraph(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') p

title: Cluster stability across resolutions — VisClusterStability
text: Assess clustering stability resampling cells varying resolution.

title: Cluster stability across resolutions — VisClusterStability
code: VisClusterStability(   object,   resolution_range = seq(0.2, 1.2, by = 0.2),   dims = 1:10,   reps = 5,   prop = 0.8,   palette = "C" )

title: Cluster stability across resolutions — VisClusterStability
text: object Seurat object PCA computed. resolution_range Numeric vector resolutions, e.g., seq(0.2, 1.2, =0.2). dims PCA dimensions use. reps Number resampling repetitions. prop Proportion cells sample per repetition. palette Viridis palette option.

title: Cluster dendrogram visualization — VisClusterTree
text: Build hierarchical tree clusters using average expression profiles.

title: Cluster dendrogram visualization — VisClusterTree
code: VisClusterTree(   object,   group.by = "seurat_clusters",   assay = NULL,   dist.metric = "euclidean",   linkage = "complete",   label.size = 3,   show_heatmap = TRUE )

title: Cluster dendrogram visualization — VisClusterTree
text: object Seurat object. group.Metadata column cluster identity. assay Assay name. dist.metric Distance metric: 'euclidean' 'correlation'. linkage Linkage method, e.g., 'complete','average','ward.D2'. label.size Label size cluster names. show_heatmap TRUE, append pairwise similarity heatmap tree.

title: Cluster dendrogram visualization — VisClusterTree
text: ggplot dendrogram (patchwork heatmap).

title: Cluster dendrogram visualization — VisClusterTree
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds p <- VisClusterTree(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') #> As of Seurat v5, we recommend using AggregateExpression to perform pseudo-bulk analysis. #> This message is displayed once per session. #> First group.by variable `seurat_clusters` starts with a number, appending `g` to ensure valid variable names #> This message is displayed once every 8 hours. p

what: Embedding density contours per group — VisEmbeddingContour
title: Embedding density contours per group — VisEmbeddingContour
text: Overlay 2D density contours groups UMAP/PCA highlight boundaries.

title: Embedding density contours per group — VisEmbeddingContour
code: VisEmbeddingContour(   object,   group.by = "seurat_clusters",   reduction = "umap",   levels = 5,   palette = NULL )

title: Embedding density contours per group — VisEmbeddingContour
text: object Seurat object UMAP PCA. group.Metadata column grouping. reduction Reduction name, default 'umap'. levels Number contour levels. palette Optional manual palette groups.

title: Embedding density contours per group — VisEmbeddingContour
text: ggplot contours.

title: Embedding density contours per group — VisEmbeddingContour
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds VisEmbeddingContour(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') #> Warning: The dot-dot notation (`..level..`) was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `after_stat(level)` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the SeuratVisPro package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://example.com/SeuratVisPro/issues>.

what: Radial hive plot of gene co-expression — VisGeneCoexpHive
title: Radial hive plot of gene co-expression — VisGeneCoexpHive
text: Visualize radial network selected genes; edge weight reflects co-expression across cells.

title: Radial hive plot of gene co-expression — VisGeneCoexpHive
code: VisGeneCoexpHive(   object,   genes,   reduction = "pca",   threshold = 0.2,   low_color = "steelblue",   mid_color = "grey80",   high_color = "firebrick" )

title: Radial hive plot of gene co-expression — VisGeneCoexpHive
text: object Seurat object. genes Character vector genes. reduction Reduction position genes radially loading (PCA). threshold Minimum absolute correlation draw edges. low_color Low color correlation. mid_color Mid color correlation. high_color High color correlation.

title: Radial hive plot of gene co-expression — VisGeneCoexpHive
text: ggplot radial hive-like network.

title: Radial hive plot of gene co-expression — VisGeneCoexpHive
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds VisGeneCoexpHive(obj, genes = paste0('G', 1:12), threshold = 0.2) #> Warning: The `slot` argument of `GetAssayData()` is deprecated as of SeuratObject 5.0.0. #> ℹ Please use the `layer` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the SeuratVisPro package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://example.com/SeuratVisPro/issues>. #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the SeuratVisPro package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://example.com/SeuratVisPro/issues>.

what: Gene expression trends along pseudotime or groups — VisGeneTrend
title: Gene expression trends along pseudotime or groups — VisGeneTrend
text: Plot smoothed trends selected genes across pseudotime approximated embeddings grouped clusters.

title: Gene expression trends along pseudotime or groups — VisGeneTrend
code: VisGeneTrend(   object,   features,   by = "pseudotime",   reduction = "umap",   dims = 1:2,   smooth.method = "loess",   palette = "C" )

title: Gene expression trends along pseudotime or groups — VisGeneTrend
text: object Seurat object UMAP PCA. features Character vector gene names. Either 'pseudotime' metadata column group . reduction Reduction use pseudotime ('umap' 'pca'). dims Dimensions used pseudotime ranking. smooth.method Smoothing method ('loess' 'gam'). palette Viridis palette option.

title: Gene expression trends along pseudotime or groups — VisGeneTrend
text: ggplot smoothed curves.

title: Gene expression trends along pseudotime or groups — VisGeneTrend
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds p <- VisGeneTrend(obj, features = c('G10','G20'), by = 'pseudotime') p #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

what: Hex-binned entropy map on embeddings — VisHexEntropy
title: Hex-binned entropy map on embeddings — VisHexEntropy
text: Compute per-bin Shannon entropy group composition UMAP/PCA visualize tile heatmap.

title: Hex-binned entropy map on embeddings — VisHexEntropy
code: VisHexEntropy(   object,   group.by = "seurat_clusters",   reduction = "umap",   bins = 30 )

title: Hex-binned entropy map on embeddings — VisHexEntropy
text: object Seurat object. group.Metadata column groups. reduction Reduction name, default 'umap'. bins Number bins per axis.

title: Hex-binned entropy map on embeddings — VisHexEntropy
text: ggplot heatmap entropy.

title: Hex-binned entropy map on embeddings — VisHexEntropy
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 300, n_genes = 800, n_clusters = 3) #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 12023 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8321 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds p <- VisHexEntropy(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters', bins = 30) p

title: Ligand-receptor co-expression scoring — VisLigRec
text: Compute simple ligand-receptor co-expression scores across groups visualize heatmap.

title: Ligand-receptor co-expression scoring — VisLigRec
code: VisLigRec(   object,   lr_table,   group.by = "seurat_clusters",   assay = NULL,   palette = "C" )

title: Ligand-receptor co-expression scoring — VisLigRec
text: object Seurat object. lr_table Data frame columns ligand receptor. group.Metadata column groups (e.g., clusters). assay Assay name. palette Viridis palette option.

title: Ligand-receptor co-expression scoring — VisLigRec
text: list score table ggplot heatmap.

title: Ligand-receptor co-expression scoring — VisLigRec
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds lr <- data.frame(ligand = paste0('G', 1:5), receptor = paste0('G', 6:10)) res <- VisLigRec(obj, lr_table = lr, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') res$plot

what: Local Moran's I hotspot for gene expression — VisLocalMoran
title: Local Moran's I hotspot for gene expression — VisLocalMoran
text: Compute local Moran's UMAP/PCA neighborhoods given gene detect spatial autocorrelation hotspots.

title: Local Moran's I hotspot for gene expression — VisLocalMoran
code: VisLocalMoran(object, gene, reduction = "umap", k = 15)

title: Local Moran's I hotspot for gene expression — VisLocalMoran
text: object Seurat object. gene Gene name. reduction Reduction name, default 'umap'. k Number nearest neighbors.

title: Local Moran's I hotspot for gene expression — VisLocalMoran
text: ggplot scatter local Moran's values.

title: Local Moran's I hotspot for gene expression — VisLocalMoran
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 300, n_genes = 800, n_clusters = 3) #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 12023 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8321 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds p <- VisLocalMoran(obj, gene = 'G10', k = 15) p

title: Marker atlas visualization — VisMarkerAtlas
text: Find top markers per cluster visualize heatmap.

title: Marker atlas visualization — VisMarkerAtlas
code: VisMarkerAtlas(   object,   top_n = 10,   logfc.threshold = 0.25,   min.pct = 0.1,   test.use = "wilcox",   palette = "C" )

title: Marker atlas visualization — VisMarkerAtlas
text: object Seurat object. top_n Number top markers per cluster. logfc.threshold Log fold-change threshold marker finding. min.pct Minimum percent expressed. test.use Differential test (e.g., 'wilcox'). palette Viridis palette option.

title: Marker atlas visualization — VisMarkerAtlas
text: list containing marker table ggplot heatmap.

title: Marker atlas visualization — VisMarkerAtlas
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds res <- VisMarkerAtlas(obj, top_n = 5) #> Calculating cluster 0 #> For a (much!) faster implementation of the Wilcoxon Rank Sum Test, #> (default method for FindMarkers) please install the presto package #> -------------------------------------------- #> install.packages('devtools') #> devtools::install_github('immunogenomics/presto') #> -------------------------------------------- #> After installation of presto, Seurat will automatically use the more  #> efficient implementation (no further action necessary). #> This message will be shown once per session #> Calculating cluster 1 #> Calculating cluster 2 res$plot

what: Module score visualization for gene sets — VisMetaFeature
title: Module score visualization for gene sets — VisMetaFeature
text: Compute module scores multiple gene sets visualize across groups.

title: Module score visualization for gene sets — VisMetaFeature
code: VisMetaFeature(   object,   feature_sets,   group.by = "seurat_clusters",   nbin = 24,   min.size = 3,   palette = NULL )

title: Module score visualization for gene sets — VisMetaFeature
text: object Seurat object. feature_sets named list character vectors genes. group.Metadata column grouping. nbin Number bins AddModuleScore. min.size Minimum gene set size keep. palette Optional fill palette.

title: Module score visualization for gene sets — VisMetaFeature
text: list updated object ggplot boxplots.

title: Module score visualization for gene sets — VisMetaFeature
code: obj <- SeuratVisProExample() #> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck #>  #> Number of nodes: 300 #> Number of edges: 11471 #>  #> Running Louvain algorithm... #> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323 #> Number of communities: 3 #> Elapsed time: 0 seconds sets <- list(SetA = paste0('G', 1:10), SetB = paste0('G', 11:20)) res <- VisMetaFeature(obj, feature_sets = sets, group.by = 'seurat_clusters') res$plot

what: Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects — VisQCPanel
title: Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects — VisQCPanel
text: Visualize key QC metrics customizable thresholds optional interactivity.

title: Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects — VisQCPanel
code: VisQCPanel(   object,   genes_mt = "^MT-",   genes_ribo = NULL,   group.by = NULL,   interactive = FALSE,   assay = NULL,   palette = "C" )

title: Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects — VisQCPanel
text: object Seurat object. genes_mt Regex mitochondrial genes. Default ^MT- human. genes_ribo Regex ribosomal genes (e.g., ^RPL|^RPS). group.Column object@meta.data used grouping. interactive TRUE, returns interactive plots via plotly::ggplotly. assay Assay use; defaults DefaultAssay(object). palette Viridis palette option.

title: Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects — VisQCPanel
text: patchwork assembled ggplot list interactive plots.

title: Interactive QC panel for Seurat v5 objects — VisQCPanel
